reviewText: i just wanted to say that i cannot belive that the dynamite kid vs chris benoit match from stampede in 1989 was not included.this was considered THE BEST MATCH OF ALL TIME once.thats why i dont buy more so called greatest hits wrestling dvds.

reviewText: Disc 1The Hart family has long served as Canada's first family of Sports Entertainment, from patriarch Stu and his Stampede Wrestling and Dungeon, a training site that has produced multiple Hall of Famers, though sons Bret, Owen, on to a new generation of WWE Superstars, The Hart Dynasty. But the family's journey was never a smooth one, as their accomplishments were often punctuated with devastating tragedies and loss. Now for the first time ever, fans can learn the entire story in Hart & Soul: The Hart Family Anthology. A brand new documentary chronicling more than 5 decades of family lineage is filled with never-before-seen Hart family interviews and supplemented with a dozen matches featuring Bret, Owen, Keith, Bruce, The British Bulldog, The Dynamite Kid, Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart, The Hart Dynasty, and more!Stu HartFalling in LoveThe PromoterHart HouseRiches to RagsAll in the FamilyHart Foundation / British BulldogsStampede SoldDeanInternational SpotlightFamily FeudCanada's FamilyStruggles WithinFamily TragedyThird GenerationReflectionsSpecial Features* Stu the Athlete* Helen's Car Accident* Terrible Ted the Wrestling Bear* A Letter from Dean* Stu vs. The Tiger* A Hart Family Thanksgiving - 1987* Helen Throws in the Towel* Owen the Prankster* Chris Jericho's Flight with Owen* The Uninvited Guest* Bret "Hit Man" Hart Returns to WWE* Post-Raw Celebration (Raw - January 4, 2010)Disc 2Introduction with The Hart Dynasty6-Man Tag Team MatchKeith Hart, Bruce Hart & Bret Hart vs. The Kiwis & Dynamite KidStampede Wrestling - January 11, 1994Ripped Apart at the SeamsWorld Tag Team Championship MatchBret "Hit Man" Hart & Owen Hart vs. The QuebecersRoyal Rumble - January 22, 1994Disc 3Sibling RivalrySteel Cage Match for the WWE ChampionshipBret "Hit Man" Hart vs. Owen HartSummerSlam - August 29, 1994The Hart Family Settles It in the RingBret "Hit Man" Hart & British Bulldog vs. Owen Hart & Jim "The Anvil" NeidhartRaw - November 7, 1994Decorated in GoldEuropean Championship MatchOwen Hart vs. British BulldogRaw - March 3, 1997Front and Center10-Man Tag Team MatchBret "Hit Man" Hart, Owen Hart, British Bulldog, Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart & Brian Pillman vs. Stone Cold Steve Austin, Ken Shamrock, Goldust & Legion of DoomIn Your House: Canadian Stampede July 6, 1997Border Wars6-Man Tag Team Flag MatchBret "Hit Man" Hart, Owen Hart & British Bulldog vs. Stone Cold Steve Austin, Undertaker & Dude LoveRaw - July 21, 1997Passing the TorchWWE Unified Tag Team Championship MatchThe Hart Dynasty vs. D-Generation XSmackDown - December 25, 2009The Best is Yet to ComeOverall, very disappointed with the match selection. While a few stand-out there could have been alot more better matches too chose from.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A great dvd overall with the exception of vinces fingerprints being apparent.Im a life long bret hart fan ive admired him since i was a small child i recently read his book and this documentary leaves a WHOLE WHOLE lot out but this is a celabration of the Hart legacy not a tell all of the familys many problems over the years.The documentary itself is fantastic and the parts about Owen left tears in my eyes from laughing and the painful memorys to.Theres a part in the bret and bulldog vs owen and neidhart where bret chases owen around the ring and the whole time owen has the stupidest look on his face i could only imagine bret fighting back laughter during the whole chase.Owen is covered alot through this dvd with laugh out loud stories and heart warming reflections on his memory.But there is a section that angered me greatly,during thebret,bruce,smith vs the kiwis and dynamite kid match bruce got split open pretty bad and the WWE PG era went into effect and they made bruces face black and white whenever he was in plain view if they are gonna start censoring their dvds then i wont be buying them unless its one of someone that i like i hate to see how theyll censor the upcoming elimanation chamber dvd set.But overall im pleased with the set watching it makes me wanna see a dynamite kid set or a davet boy smith set i really think its time for a three disc set for owen they owe him that much to make a set celebrating his life
summary: A amazing set for a amazing story
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great set of the Hart family with many short segments delving into the history of the family along with a wide array of matches. In between the matches are wrap around segments featuring 'The Hart Dynasty' giving their insights into the following match.Some of these matches are repeats from the Bret Hart DVD but the difference is that these bouts also feature pre-match interviews and/or ring entrances that were cut off from the Bret Hart DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's honestly been a few months since I watched this DVD.  I can't remember much about it.  I remember not learning anything new though.  If you haven't seen Bret Hart's dvd or read his book then you might learn some new stuff here.  This dvd needed to be released to reflect on one of the coolest wrestling families of all time.If you are looking to learn anything new from this set sorry to tell you that you wont.  The match listing is worth the bucks alone.  Not horrible, but the story was told before the dvd came out.  Still pick it up if you like wrestling.  You will like it even though you know how it ends.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay so I can't really review this DVD set because I haven't seen it. Except for a very small portion as I thought it was a different DVD set. Due to this, I couldn't give it a fair star rating. It's not that I have a problem with sitting down and actually watching it, because I really don't (I'll watch nearly anything), it's just that I refuse to watch it. The reason being that I wouldn't be able to watch it without thinking about the widow of Owen Hart and ya know, that stupid lawsuit that came in the aftermath of this DVD set. The truth of the matter is simple: I have nothing but a ton of respect for Bret Hart and I mean no disrespect whatsoever, but I just - I just I can't..
Title: N/A

reviewText: Guerrero's, McMahon's, Vachon's, Funk's, Von Erich's, Anoai's...these are all names of some of the biggest influences & names in the wrestling business but there is one wrestling family in the wrestling business who can't be denied as one of the greatest wrestling families of all time, the Hart Family.  This is a DVD presentation on the history of the Hart Family with their history in & outside of the wrestling business documented along with an anthology of matches featuring members of the family in action.  Throughout the documentry, you hear from various members of the Hart family from the various wrestlers (Keith, Bret, Bruce, Hart Dynasty, brother-in-law Jim Niedhart), Helen & Stu's daughters (Georgina, Elle, Diana) & granddaughters (Georgia & Kristen), along with others (Mad Dog Vachon, Wild Samoan Sika, Rocky Johnson, Chris Jericho, and former Mayor Of Calgary Ralph Klein.)The documentry begins talking about Stu Hart's childhood of growing up "dirt poor" & how wrestling was introduced to him before going into the love story of how he met Helen & the story behind both of them not being able to have kids (which I laughed at knowing at how many kids they ended up having).  How he got into being a promoter for the Stampede Wrestling promotion along with his highly positive reputation is discussed before going into the story being the Hart House including stories of how many animals they had (including where they kept the bear) and you'll also get a funny visual of how the house looked like a circus show with all the various animals & wrestlers on the property.  How the Harts went from being so rich to becoming very poor is discussed before going into the details of how all the boys got involved in the wrestling business with various jobs including Bruce becoming a booker that brought in various famous names such as Jake Roberts & Junkyard Dog & British Bulldogs is talked about before going into the stories of how Jim Niedhart & Davey Boy Smith were married into the family.  The discussion turns into how the family felt pride in regards to the quality delievered by the British Bulldog vs. Hart Foundation feud including them being apart of WrestleMania III before going into the story behind Stu selling the Stampede territory & how Bruce was very upset about it only to start it up again again which gave people like Owen & Brian Pillman their start.  The first tragedy in the family with Dean Hart's death is discussed before going into the family feuds such as the story behind SummerSlam '92 with Davey & Bret wrestling in the main event with Davey having a staff infection going into the match along with the Bret vs. Owen feud that finally gave Owen Hart the spotlight.  Another tradegy involving the son of Stu's daughter Georgia's son dying from a flesh eating disease is talked about before going into discussion about the Hart Foundation reunion with the "U.S.A. vs. Canada" war with the highlight being the Canadian Stampede PPV showcasing the last great moment with the entire family together with highlights of where the members of the Hart Dynasty were during the celebration.  The documentry takes a downwards turn here as we begin to talk about the downfalls of the family with the death of Brian Pillman (who was concidered a brother), the Montreal Screwjob, their WCW careers which Anvil summerized as "a big mistake", and how Bulldog's painkiller addiction began due to his time in WCW.  The death of Owen Hart is discussed next with everyone reflecting on Owen's life, how the lawsuit afterwards divided the family to this day, and how this was related to Helen's death.  The deaths of Davey & Stu along with the Hart House being sold are discussed before the documentry is ended on a positive note discussing the formation of the Hart Dynasty (including a mention of Teddy Hart) with stories of how Natayla being the only third generation female & going against her Dad's wishes, how Harry is very similar to his father by having crusierweight abilities with his size, and Bret describing Tyson Kidd as having "excellence of execution."  Also throughout the documentry, you get mini-profiles on the Hart children with various comments from the various family members before final reflections of the family close out the documentry.Bonus Matches (hosted by The Hart Dynasty) Include:Keith & Bruce & Bret Hart vs. The Kiwis & Dynamite Kid - This was joined in progress & keep in mind that the quality isn't shart as this is archival footage.  This was a mix of brawling & wrestling but ended up getting too out of control in the end but it was a good match for it's time."Stampede Wrestling" May '79WWE Tag Team Champions British Bulldogs vs. Hart Foundation - These two tag teams were stealing the show at live events during this time (to the point where this is the fourth time a match against each other has been released to DVD).  You got a funny moment before the match between the Bulldog's mascot Matilda & Foundation's manager Jimmy Hart.  The Foundation tried to double team Dynamite Kid early but was able to fight his way out of their corner before Davey tagged in & showcased his unbelieveable ability for a man his size including countering an irish whip into a cruifix pin attempt.  Unfortunally for the Foundation, Niedhart taking advantage of the referee would come back to haunt them in this match but this was just another classic showcase between these two teams."Boston Garden" Nov. '86WWE Intercontinental Champion Bret Hart vs. British Bulldog - This was a historic match on many levels as this was the only time that only the Intercontinental Championship main evented a PPV & this the second largest WWE crowd to date. Eventhough there were some botches (that Bret acknowledged in his DVD set), these were two of the best WRESTLERS WWE had that that time giving quite the classic performance with the "Diana Hart" factor adding to the drama of the match. As a side note, we get the prematch interviews between both men & Diana in the audience as a bonus here.SummerSlam '92["History Of Intercontinental Championship", "Bret Hart: Best There Is, Best There Was, Best There Ever Will Be", "Best Of WWE Confidental"]Elimination Match: Bret & Owen & Bruce & Keith Hart vs. Shawn Michaels & His Knights - Before I get started incase anyone is confused why Shawn Michaels is teaming with a bunch of "knights", this was originally suppost to be Jerry Lawler in the match but he left WWE for personal issues right before the show causing Shawn Michaels (fresh off being suspended himself) to be a last minute replacement while members of the Hart family were seated at ringside along with Stu Hart being in the corner for the Hart brothers.  Outside of seeing the Hart Brothers together with Stu in the corner (along with the comedic interaction between Bobby Heenan & then-Family Feud host Ray Combs), this match was only highlighted by Shawn Michaels being the underrated workhorse that he was at that time by carrying his team & the elimination from the Hart Family that would lead to what is concidered the biggest family feud in WWE history with the constant use of the name "The Shadow" during the commentary foreshadowing the events that would unfold.Survivor Series '93[Most Powerful Wrestling Families]Bret & Owen Hart vs. Steiner Brothers - A "lost" match here as I don't even remember these four wrestling against each other...but I'm glad they did.  Bret & Scott traded amature wrestling early with various single & double leg takedowns in the beginning with Rick & Owen later doing the same thing with chain wrestling later on.  Both teams throughout the match were just about even on the technical ability with the the Harts having a speed advantage & the Steiners having a power advantage including one moment where Scott Steiner turned a suplex into a piledriver.  You saw the early signs of Bret's knee injury as he did hurt it in this match & later returned the favor by going after one of the Steiner's shoulder.  This was a very intense battle that did turn into a brawl & got too out of control to the point where the match got thrown out and had officials break up both teams fighting after the match at least 3 times before cooler heads prevailed in the end.  I try to not throw out the word "classic" too much but I'll concider this a lost classic when it comes to tag team wrestling during that period in WWE & I really wish that we would have seen more from all four of these men afterwards.Jan. '94WWE Tag Team Champions The Quebecers vs. Bret & Owen Hart - Before I get started...for those who don't recognize the Quebecers manager (Johnny Polo), he's better known as Raven from ECW/WWE/WCW/TNA.  This was a back & forth match between both tag teams but the match itself was only a backdrop to the issues from Survivor Series once again coming forth as Bret injured his knee here with the Quebecers constantly punishing Bret & kept him from tagging only for Bret to have an opportunity to tag & not taking it by trying to win the match that cost them the match in end...leading to a heavily upset Owen to deliver the "kick heard 'round the world."Royal Rumble '94Steel Cage Match: WWE Champion Bret Hart vs. Owen Hart - The entire Hart family was sitting at ringside for this match including Stu & Helen along with the in-laws of Jim Niedhart (who sided with Owen) & Davey Boy Smith (who sided with Bret).  Bret Hart said it himself, "We made people forget that a cage match is usually a bloody masscre." This was a classic professional wrestling match to the point to where the cage was only there just to make the moves more high impact...such as that superplex from the top of the cage.  The steel cage intended to keep Bret & Owen in the ring while keeping the rest of the family out but the aftermath of the match would definately test that theory.SummerSlam '94["History Of WWE Championship" & "Bloodbath: Wrestling's Most Dangerous Steel Cage Matches"]Bret Hart & Davey Boy Smith vs. Owen Hart & Jim Neidhart - This started off as a brawl but later calmed down in a regular wrestling match. It went back & forth between both teams before Bulldog was heavily worked over while Owen & Anvil constantly caused a distraction with either the referee or Bret himself to prevent Davey from making the tag before he was finally able to make the hot tag to a fresh Bret to led his team to victory.  This was a good tag team match."Raw" Nov. '94WWE European Championship Match: Owen Hart vs. British Bulldog - This was the finals of the tournament to crown the first European Champion. At this time, Owen & Bulldog were not only tag team partners but Tag Team Champions for around 5 months at this point. This was a very technical match with both men continuing to show mutual respect towards each other with the crowd getting behind the hometown favorite in the Bulldog. Things didn't start getting dirty till the end with Owen faking an injury but still, this was a great match & damn near perfect way to introduce the new championship."Raw" Mar. '97[Best Of RAW: 15th Anniversary]Hart Foundation vs. Steve Austin, Ken Shamrock, Goldust, Legion of Doom - This was one of the most unique main events in wrestling history as the Hart Foundation were heels in America but babyfaces everywhere else in the world so they had a heavy hometown advantage with this PPV being in the hometown of the Hart Family of Calgary, Alberta, Canada. This was a wild six man tag with various moments like the opening minutes between Bret & Austin, Niedhart mocking Ken Shamrock & paying for it, Austin going so far as to attack the Hart family members at ringside...including getting his hands on Stu, both Owen & Austin being taken out of the match, Pillman making an ass of himself, and the aftermath & celebration."IYH: Canadian Stampede" July '97[Brian Pillman: Loose Cannon]Flag Match: Bret Hart, Owen Hart, British Bulldog vs. Steve Austin, Undertaker, Dude Love - This started off with just Austin & Dude Love in a handicap match before Undertaker joined their team later on.  With the match taking place in Canada, the Harts were the heavy fan favorites here that had a mix of wrestling & brawling between both teams before the "forgotten" member of the Foundation helped the team to victory."Raw" July '97[Joined In Progress On "Best Of RAW: 15th Anniversary"]WWE Unified Tag Team Champion D-Generation X vs. Hart Dynasty - Eventhough this was setup to be a regular Tag Team Title defense, there was a little background story here concidering how it was this version of DX over a decade earlier that eliminated the Hart Foundation from the WWE.  This started off early with Triple H doing his usual mockery of the other team with his taunting D.H. Smith with his dad's (British Bulldog) delayed suplex on Tyson Kidd before Smith returned the favor later on.  The Dynasty got the advantage by working over Shawn throughout most of the match building to the hot tag for Triple H to lead the team to victory but it was a good TV quality match & a good showcasing for the Dynasty."SmackDown" Dec. '09I'll say that the documentry is definately one of the best ones WWE has ever done as they showed the proper respect to not just the wrestling history of the family but their entire legacy as a family.  As for the match selection, I know that there are a bunch of repeats from other DVD sets but for this being an anthology of the family (not just one select member like Bret, Owen, ect.) then some of the repeats are acceptable...however the keyword here is "some" because I have to ask if the Bret/Bulldog match was absolutely necessary on here since this is the 4th DVD set to have this match on here including Bret's own set...I figured that's why they didn't include any other Bret vs. Owen or Bulldog matches on here since they were already on Bret's set as well.  I would have prefered a different match such as an Owen & Bulldog tag match (maybe where they won the tag titles), that forgotten "No Holds Barred" match between Bret & Owen from RAW in Jan. '95, or even a match with Owen & Niedhart as the New Foundation but overall, the match quality from this list is there...just not a big fan on repeating the same match on so many DVD sets.  In the end, this is definately a set I would pick up if you haven't already...no questions asked.
summary: Triumph & Tradegy Of The Hart Family
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Hart family is responsible for some of the biggest stars and most beloved cult figures in pro wrestling history. From the famous (Bret "Hitman" Hart, Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart, "Rocket" Owen Hart, "Superstar" Billy Graham, Chris Jericho, Davey Boy Smith, Natalyia Neidhart) to the not so famous but popular cult figures (Lance Storm, Justin Credible of ECW fame) to the infamous (The Dynamite Kid, Chris Benoit, Teddy Hart), this family has definitely left its mark on this business! Now, the story of this family comes to DVD!Disc 1 is the basic biography showing the beginnings of Stu, how he met Helen, the rise and fall of Stampede Wrestling and the triumphs and tragedies of the Hart Family. We also see additional stories in special features section that include footage of the RAW episode where Bret Hart returned to RAW after a 12 year absence and the post-RAW celebration afterwards.On a personal note, let me also recommend this set for those clamoring to know about Owen Hart. This is probably the closest we will ever see to a biography from WWE about Owen since there is a legal battle between WWE and Owen's widow Martha Hart and Martha wants nothing to do with pro wrestling, especially WWE! While I personally can't blame Martha (her husband was killed in an accidental but totally avoidable way), at some point the anger has to go. Again, only my personal opinion but what do I know?Back to the DVD set, here is what's on Disc 2:I should note that Disc 2 and 3 are hosted by The Hart Dynasty (David Smith, Natalyia Neidhart and Tyson Kidd). And, as before with some of my other reviews, I will refer to the title matches as WWF where warranted and WWE where warranted.Keith, Bruce & Bret Hart Vs. The Kiwis & Dynamite Kid - Pretty good six man but with the PG rules in effect, the blood was taken out by changing the color on it! Booo! Still, worth a look!The Hart Foundation Vs. The British Bulldogs (WWF World Tag Team Title Match) - While these two teams have had better matches, this one doesn't suck by no means! You could even make a case that the Harts (though heels) got screwed this night! LOL! Anyway, another battle between these two legendary tag teams!Bret "Hitman" Hart Vs. "The British Bulldog" Davey Boy Smith (WWF Intercontinental Title Match) - This is their famous SummerSlam match and while its been shown time and time again on other sets, this is one repeat I have no problem with. This is one of those matches that no description I can give it will do it justice! THIS IS A MUST VIEW IF YOU'VE NEVER SEEN IT!Bret, Owen, Bruce & Keith Vs. Shawn Michaels & His Knights - This was from Survivor Series 1993 and laid the foundation for the future Bret Vs. Owen feud. Still, it was an okay match which was more about showing off the Hart brothers than anything. It also debuted Owen using the sharpshooter for the first time!Bret & Owen Hart Vs. Rick & Scott Steiner - This match is a "lost classic" in my eyes and a MUST VIEW on this set! We know about the skills of Bret and his late brother Owen but if all you know of Scott Steiner is "Big Poppa Pump", you need to see this! He actually holds his own and even outwrestles (at times) the Harts as does his brother Rick! And, you must see the Steiner Screwdriver! I had heard of it but never seen it until this match! It made me almost fall out of my couch! LOL!Seriously, you must see this contest! It is too bad they didn't do a full program with these teams! It would've been a classic!Bret & Owen Hart Vs. The Quebecers (WWF World Tag Team Title Match) - A very good contest from the 1994 Royal Rumble but also saw the full blown beginnings of Bret Hart Vs. Owen Hart!Disc 3:Bret "Hitman" Hart Vs. "Rocket" Owen Hart (WWF World Title Match in a cage) - This is still considered a classic and shows that steel cage matches don't necessarily have to be bloodbaths to be good! Also, you will see various Hart family members get involved, particularly The British Bulldog and Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart. I would consider this one a MUST VIEW as well!Bret "Hitman" Hart & "The British Bulldog" Davey Boy Smith Vs. "Rocket" Owen Hart & Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart - A tag team match from RAW and a pretty good one."Rocket" Owen Hart Vs. "The British Bulldog" Davey Boy Smith (WWF European Title Match) - This was the finals of a tournament for the now defunct European title. Amazingly, this match (except for a few instances) was clean despite the fact that both men were heels at this point! The Germany crowd was solidly behind The Bulldog in this one as he claimed the European title!Bret "Hitman" Hart, "Rocket" Owen Hart, "The British Bulldog" Davey Boy Smith, Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart & "Loose Cannon" Brian Pillman Vs. "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Ken Shamrock, Goldust & The Legion Of Doom - One of the wildest 10 man tags ever with The Hart Foundation clearly the fan favorites in Canada though they were heels! Ends with a heartening (no pun intended) scene of the whole family celebrating in the ring and greeting the crowd.Bret "HitMan" Hart, "Rocket" Owen Hart & "The British Bulldog" Davey Boy Smith Vs. "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, The Undertaker & Dude Love (Mick Foley) - This was a flag match which the first team to capture their country's flag would win! Originally scheduled to be Shawn Michaels, he bowed out so UT took his place. The crowd, being in Canada, were behind their country men and booed the heck out of Austin and Foley though it was mixed for The Undertaker (I think it was more out of respect). Pretty good six man that saw the Harts win.The Hart Dynasty Vs. D-Generation X (WWE World Tag Team Title Match) - Pretty good match from Smackdown. Given the history between these two teams (particularly concerning Bret Hart), you knew this one would be hot! The Hart Dynasty would win the titles eventually but it wasn't to be this night as DX retained.Overall, this is a good set to pick up whether like new, used or brand new! May I also recommend gettingWWE - Bret "Hitman" Hart: The Best There Is, The Best There Was, The Best There Ever Will Bewhich features his tribute match with the now infamous Chris Benoit (for those that still want their Benoit fix) andHitman Hart: Wrestling With Shadows - 10th Anniversary Collector's Editionwhich also has a one hour biography from A & E on Owen Hart. Between those three, you'll have a pretty good idea of who and what this family is and what they have meant to the business of sports entertainment!
summary: One Of The Best WWE DVD Sets In Recent Years!

reviewText: Details of the hart DVD from SilvervisionThe Hart family has long served as Canada's first family of Sports Entertainment, from patriarch Stu and his Stampede Wrestling and Dungeon, a training site that has produced multiple Hall of Famers, though sons Bret, Owen, on to a new generation of WWE Superstars, The Hart Dynasty. But the family's journey was never a smooth one, as their accomplishments were often punctuated with devastating tragedies and loss. Now for the first time ever, fans can learn the entire story in Hart & Soul: The Hart Family Anthology. A brand new documentary chronicling more than 5 decades of family lineage is filled with never-before-seen Hart family interviews and supplemented with a dozen matches featuring Bret, Owen, Keith, Bruce, The British Bulldog, The Dynamite Kid, Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart, The Hart Dynasty, and more!Disc 1Stu HartFalling in LoveThe PromoterHart HouseRiches to RagsAll in the FamilyHart Foundation / British BulldogsStampede SoldDeanInternational SpotlightFamily FeudCanada's FamilyStruggles WithinFamily TragedyThird GenerationReflectionsSpecial Features* Stu the Athlete* Helen's Car Accident* Terrible Ted the Wrestling Bear* A Letter from Dean* Stu vs. The Tiger* A Hart Family Thanksgiving - July 21, 1997Passing the TorchWWE Unified Tag Team Championship MatchThe Hart Dynasty vs. D-Generation XSmackDown - December 25, 2009The Best is Yet to ComeOnly 12 matches, with 5 of them available on other WWE dvds currently in circulation knocks this release down from 5 stars to 4---I would have loved to see:Hart Foundation's Two Tag Title wins over Demolition and the BulldogsBret vs. Mr. Perfect (from Primetime Wrestling--not available on DVD)Hart Foundation/Honky Tonk Man vs. Strike Force/Macho Man in cage (1988)Bret vs. Stone Cold Steve Austin Raw Street Fight (1997)Bret vs. Ric Flair (first Title win 1992)Hopefully some (or all) of these will see the light of day in the future as surely Bret is worthy of a 3rd DVD release as Michaels,Rock, Austin, Triple H, Undertaker, Hulk Hogan and even Mick Foley have at least that many.In the mean time, this release is a can't miss for me!
summary: Wish There were more than 12 matches!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Short Review: This video is very well nicely put together with plenty of interviews with the remaining members of the Hart family and other wrestlers. There are lots of lovely family pictures and videos included for the early part of the documentary that gives a great insight into their family life. There is no doubt that this family is one of the most successful families in wrestling simply because of the amount of them that have gone on to have great careers in the ring.If your interested in finding out more about this great wrestling family then I would highly recommend watching this documentary.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Unlike some of the other reviewers who are complaining about what is NOT on this set, I  picked it up the other day (fye has it bundled with a 3 Disc DVD of Bret Hart for $[...]) and I enjoyed it tremendously. The documentary was interesting and at an hour and a half seemed like it could have been much longer (and the bonus features indicate  it could have).I did enjoy most of the  matches and while a few may be available elsewhere I think not including some on this set would have left this feeling a bit empty. I enjoyed the chronological approach to the matches and they told a bit about the Hart family story arc in the WWF/E. While not all the matches are on the caliber of Bret and Davey's championship in the UK most are fun and for 8plus hours at under 20 bucks I can't rate this less than 5 stars.
summary: for under $20 there is plenty of story and plenty of matches....
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great little item. It tells more about their lives and how the wrestling business is part of their lives. It tells us everything is ever needed to know about the whole family, even the ones that aren't in the business at all. Also, tells us more about the background of their actual lives and behind the scenes from the show. I recommend this collection.
summary: Solid history about the Hart family
Title: N/A

reviewText: For fans of 1980s wrestling, this a must-see. The documentary does not skip much in the tragic history of the family and the matches are well selected. This set is a wonderful companion for the Bret Hart set and well worth grabbing.
summary: Fascinating Look At A Not Normal Family
Title: N/A

reviewText: Hart and Soul is a DVD set about perhaps the WWE's greatest wrestling family:  The Hart family.  Disc 1 is basically a documentary about the Hart family beginning with Stu and Helen Hart then going into the kids that wrestled with the most famous being Bret and Owen Hart.  After, that you basically get learn about the in laws that wrestled like Jim Neidhart and British Bulldog and then ending with the future of the Hart family like with Natayla Neidhart.  All in all the documentary is good and has some interesting special features like the one on Helen Hart's car accident that took some of her looks from her or the story about Chris Jericho and Owen Hart.  Also included in the special features is the return of Bret to the WWE and the post celebration that happened as well.  The 2nd and 3rd discs are the matches.  The first match is from Stampede wrestling and it features Bret, Bruce and Keith Hart against the Kiwis and Dynamite Kid.  This was a good match but not the greatest.  I would have really liked to have seen more of Bret and Dynamite like their one 60 min match that they had in Stampede.  Still, this match was pretty good.  The next match is the Hart Foundation (Bret and Jim Neidhart) against the British Bulldogs (Davy Boy and Dynamite).  This is an excellent match as most of their matches were in that era.  Check out just how good Dynamite was.  The only thing I would have really liked to have seen is the match where the Foundation wins the tag titles from the Bulldogs but hey this match is good too.  Then you get the IC title match from Summerslam 1992 between Bret and Bulldog.  Man is this a pure wrestling match from start to finish.  This match is actually my favorite Summerslam match of all time (to date) and when you see it, if you never have, you will see why.  God, this is a great match.  The next one is the 1993 Survivor Series match with Bret, Owen, Bruce and Keith Hart against Shawn Michaels and his "knights." Pretty good match but is only good when Shawn is in the ring with any of the Harts, otherwise, the match is brutal.  I never have found out who the knights were but whoever they were sucked big time.  This match was supposed to be Jerry Lawler and his knights against the Harts but Lawler got in some trouble with the law (a rape allegation or something like that) and they threw Shawn in at the last moment.  This match is mainly known for Owen coming out and getting into it with Bret.  The following match is after the holidays when Bret and Owen made up and has them taking on the Steiners.  I remember Bret saying something like he didn't like this match in his book but I got to tell you I thought this one was spot on good.  The only downfall is the ending because it ends in a double countout.  After that you get the match from the Royal Rumble in 1995 when Bret and Owen team up to take on the Quebecers for the tag titles.  This was a good match but will be remembered for Owen turning his back on Bret and tearing him up because Bret would not tag him into the match even though he was "hurt."  Honestly, I felt myself siding with Owen on this one and wondered why Bret was trying to steal the glory as well.  Still a good match.  Disc 3 was more matches and started with the awesome cage match between Bret and Owen from Summerslam 1994.  No blood but plenty of action in this one that goes for over 30:00.  This is actually my favorite cage match of all time as it really wasn't about the violence or the blood it was about the strategy of escaping the cage and becoming or retaining the world title.  The match itself was like 33:00 and I once counted how many escape attempts there were in the match and it was 38 of them, so if break that down that's like an esacape attempt every minute of the match with 5 left over.  Great match!!  Next is Bret and Bulldog teaming up against Owen and Jim Neidhart.  This was a pretty good match, nothing more nothing less.  Next you get a fantastic match that was for the European title on Raw and it was Bulldog vs Owen for the belt.  This was a very good match that is pretty underrated for its time.  Some people actually think that the best Hart of them all was Owen.  It's hard to argue that after watching this match.  He is great in this one and Bulldog holds his own as well.  The next one I knew they would put on there as it was Bret, Owen, Jim, Bulldog and Brian Pillman taking on Steve Austin, Ken Shamrock, Goldust and the Legion of Doom.  This match was at In Your House in Canada and the intensity that night was off the chart good.  This match was everything you could want in a 10 man tag with loads of action and even some of the family outside the ring getting into it.  When it's all over it's like a Hart family reunion in the ring and if I'm not mistaken if you look closely I think you can see little Natayla Neidhart in the ring celebrating.  The next one is Bret, Owen and Bulldog against Steve Austin, Undertaker and Dude Love in a flag match.  This was an ok match where the winner gets to wave their flag around proudly.  Nothing really more to say about it.  The final match is a new generation match that features DX against The Hart Dynasty (David Hart Smith who was Bulldog's son and Tyson Kidd who was the last person trained in the Hart Family Dungeon).  Again this was a fantastic match to include on the set and lets us kind of get a preview of the future.All in all this was a great set from start to finish with some really good matches involved.  I do think they could have maybe added a few more matches to the set like the Foundation winning the tag titles from the Bulldogs or one of their cage matches that they did.  I also would have liked to have seen the street fight match with Bret and Owen on Raw.  Something else that suprised me is that there were no matches with Owen and Bulldog defending their tag titles or winning tag titles.  That was pretty suprising.  I also would have liked to have seen the Foundation defending their tag titles along the way as well.  Still though, this set is a great campanion piece to the Bret Hart set that was released.  Hopefully we'll see maybe like a Bret Hart anthology set or a Bret Hart unreleased set.
Title: N/A
